archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.physdesc: Ca. 100 items (3 Hollinger boxes, 1 linear foot).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of Paul T. David, Accession #12793, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was given to the University of Virginia Library by Paul T. David in 1961.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Economist, government official, author, University of Virginia professor from 1960-1977 (former chairman of the Dept. of Political Science and Woodrow Wilson Dept. of Foreign Affairs; elected Professor Emeritus of Government and Foreign Affairs 1977 April).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This set of papers from UVA political science professor Paul T. David consists of ca. 100 items (3 Hollinger boxes, 1 linear foot) and includes reports and correspondence by and between David and others on the development of commercial aviation in the post-World War II period. There is a set of bound volumes of transcripts of an oral interview of David conducted in 1990-1992. There is correspondence between David and Richard Niehoff concerning a biography of noted educational statesman Floyd W. Reeves and a copy of the draft biography.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by topic (aviation, oral history transcripts, and Reeves biography). Aviation materials are arranged alphabetically by material type. Oral history transcripts are arranged chronologically. The Reeves materials are divided into correspondence and manuscript.

scopecontent.p: The International Civil Aviation Conference and Its Sequel The Anglo-American Bermuda Air Transport Agreements and International Civil Aviation Conference, Chicago, 1944: Some Issues Decided, and Events Occurring There; The 1946 Bermuda air Transport Agreement by L. Welch Pogue and John Marshall Pogue.
Report to the Civil Aeronautics Board on the Chicago International Aviation Conference and Development of the Convention of International Civil Aviation by Virginia C. Little
A Review of the Work at the Chicago Conference (from a Secretariat Point of View) by Paul T. David
